pkgmetadata.longdescription:
kilroy-face-discord

kilroy face for Discord ðŸŽ®[![Lint](https://github.com/kilroybot/kilroy-face-discord/actions/workflows/lint.yaml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/kilroybot/kilroy-face-discord/actions/workflows/lint.yaml)[![Multiplatform tests](https://github.com/kilroybot/kilroy-face-discord/actions/workflows/test-multiplatform.yaml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/kilroybot/kilroy-face-discord/actions/workflows/test-multiplatform.yaml)[![Docker tests](https://github.com/kilroybot/kilroy-face-discord/actions/workflows/test-docker.yaml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/kilroybot/kilroy-face-discord/actions/workflows/test-docker.yaml)[![Docs](https://github.com/kilroybot/kilroy-face-discord/actions/workflows/docs.yaml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/kilroybot/kilroy-face-discord/actions/workflows/docs.yaml)
---## InstallingUsing `pip`:```shpip install kilroy-face-discord```## UsageTo run the face server, install the package and run the following command:```shkilroy-face-discord```This will start the face server on port 10000 by default.Then you can communicate with the server, for example by using[this package](https://github.com/kilroybot/kilroy-face-client-py-sdk).
